Both TNF-a and IL-6 are cytokines, which are proteins that are involved in the immune response. TNF-a is a pro-inflammatory cytokine that plays a role in the immune response to infection and inflammation, while IL-6 is a cytokine that is involved in the regulation of immune responses and inflammation.
